deployedGeneratedSources.name: #utility.yul

documentation.text:
@title TukiFulfillableV1
 @dev Base escrow contract, holds funds designated for a beneficiary until they
 withdraw them or a refund is emitted.
 Intended usage: This contract (and derived escrow contracts) should be a
 standalone contract, that only interacts with the contract that instantiated
 it. That way, it is guaranteed that all Ether will be handled according to
 the `Escrow` rules, and there is no need to check for payable functions or
 transfers in the inheritance tree. The contract that uses the escrow as its
 payment method should be its owner, and provide public methods redirecting
 to the escrow's deposit and withdraw.
@return The service ID of the escrow.
@return The fee amount in wei of the escrow.

@dev Stores the sent amount as credit to be claimed.
 @param fulfillmentRequest The destination address of the funds.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Address is not allowed any refunds"

documentation.text:
@dev The fulfiller registers a fulfillment.
 We need to verify the amount of the fulfillment is actually available to release.
 Then we can enrich the result with an auto-incremental unique ID.
 and the timestamp when the record get inserted.
 If the fulfillment has failed:
 - a refund will be authorized for a later withdrawal.
 If these verifications pass:
 - add the amount fulfilled to the release pool.
 - substract the amount from the payer's deposits.
 - persist this as a FulFillmentRecord to the blockchain.
 @param fulfillment the fulfillment result attached to it.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "There is no balance to release."

arguments.value: There is no balance to release.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "There is no balance to release."

documentation.text: @dev Withdraws the beneficiary's available balance to release (fulfilled with success).

devdoc.details: Base escrow contract, holds funds designated for a beneficiary until they withdraw them or a refund is emitted. Intended usage: This contract (and derived escrow contracts) should be a standalone contract, that only interacts with the contract that instantiated it. That way, it is guaranteed that all Ether will be handled according to the `Escrow` rules, and there is no need to check for payable functions or transfers in the inheritance tree. The contract that uses the escrow as its payment method should be its owner, and provide public methods redirecting to the escrow's deposit and withdraw.

beneficiaryWithdraw().details: Withdraws the beneficiary's available balance to release (fulfilled with success).

deposit((address,uint256,uint256,string).details: Stores the sent amount as credit to be claimed.

params.fulfillmentRequest: The destination address of the funds.

returns._0: The fee amount in wei of the escrow.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

registerFulfillment((uint256,address,add.details: The fulfiller registers a fulfillment. We need to verify the amount of the fulfillment is actually available to release. Then we can enrich the result with an auto-incremental unique ID. and the timestamp when the record get inserted. If the fulfillment has failed: - a refund will be authorized for a later withdrawal. If these verifications pass: - add the amount fulfilled to the release pool. - substract the amount from the payer's deposits. - persist this as a FulFillmentRecord to the blockchain.

params.fulfillment: the fulfillment result attached to it.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns._0: The service ID of the escrow.

params.amount: The destination address of the funds.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdrawRefund(address).details: Refund accumulated balance for a refundee, forwarding all gas to the recipient. WARNING: Forwarding all gas opens the door to reentrancy vulnerabilities. Make sure you trust the recipient, or are either following the checks-effects-interactions pattern or using {ReentrancyGuard}.

params.refundee: The address whose funds will be withdrawn and transferred to.

devdoc.title: TukiFulfillableV1
